intro: Rotheca wildii f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth rotheca, is a variant of the species Rotheca wildii, characterized by its glabrous (smooth) foliage. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and similar species. The plant typically features small, tubular flowers that are often white or pale blue in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
